wiki: Karl Heinrich Marx (May 5, 1818ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â‚¬Å“March 14, 1883) was a German[1] philosopher, political economist, historian, political theorist, sociologist, communist and revolutionary credited as the founder of communism.
Marx summarized his approach to history and politics in the opening line of the first chapter of The Communist Manifesto (1848): ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã…â€œThe history of all hitherto existing society is the history of class struggles.ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚ï¿½ Marx argued that capitalism, like previous socioeconomic systems, will produce internal tensions which will lead to its destruction.[2] Just as capitalism replaced feudalism, socialism will in its turn replace capitalism and lead to a stateless, classless society which will emerge after a transitional period, the "dictatorship of the proletariat".
